alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 3:56PM MST until August 15 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 355 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from near Antelope Canyon, northeastward to Labyrinth Canyon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, LeChee, Antelope Creek Basin, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Antelope Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Sand Wash, Kaibito Creek and Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Enhanced risk for violent, life-threatening flash flooding in slot canyons and normally dry washes.Flash floods can come from distant thunderstorms, even with little or no rainfall in the immediate area.
